g.text: In initial phase focus on layers separation and introducing Onion Architecture - UI Layer, Core Layer, Infrastructure layer. Apply
speciÔ¨Åc grouping model for every layer ( Domains, Application Services etc ). In the beginning of the project you won't notice
problems with scale. When project will evolve and you see that splitting code into domains is not enough move to next phase.
Having multiple domains after some time becomes problematic, but it's usually easy to group them into Bounded Context. Group
your domains when you notice that it's possible to wrap part of the codebase into groups. Same thing comes for speciÔ¨Åc
You will notice that with progress of time, your project will expand into multiple bounded context, functionality groups which in
general is right direction of growth. When you notice that having bounded contexts within one codebase is introducing
maintenance problems move to next phase.
When you notice that maintaining Bounded Context is getting harder in one codebase it's time to detach into separate
modules. It's not like we resign from Bounded Context pattern, we modularize project codebase basing on it. After that
we will still evolve towards Bounded Contexts within Module scope starting with initial phase.
Modules in a growth phases are going through both grouping phases related to Bounded Context Evolution cycle -
Bounded Context Phase and Bounded Context Growth Phase. Every module might be in a separate lifecycle phase
depending on growth speed. Modules are growing independently and it's up to team when to switch to next phase.
When you notice that adding additional modules to codebase becomes problematic and hard to maintain, it's the
best time to detach into microservices and start lifecycle from the beginning. You can detach into as many
microservices as needed usually they are related to previously crystalized modules.
